meanings.definition: An expression of disgust or aversion.
meanings.sent2: Yuck, I don't want to eat that slimy food.
meanings.sent3: Yuck, the smell of the garbage made me wrinkle my nose.
meanings.sent4: The taste of the medicine was like a big yuck in my mouth.
meanings.sent5: The yuck on his face showed how much he disliked the taste.

meanings.definition: To find something distasteful or unpleasant.
meanings.sent1: I yuck at the thought of eating bugs.
meanings.sent2: She always yucks at the sight of spiders.
meanings.sent3: The cat yucked at the new food before walking away.
meanings.sent4: His mind yucked at the idea of jumping into the cold water.
meanings.sent5: The texture of the food made her yuck and push the plate away.
